text: Seafood is amazing! I love the new decor, and the service is fast and friendly. If you sit at the bar, you can watch the chefs work their magic. The clams are fantastic, and very fresh. We didn't get a chance to try the sushi, but others at the bar seemed to enjoy it. My top picks are the gigantic shrimp cocktail, and any of the seafood pasta dishes. My only complaint? They give you Hawaiian rolls. The sauces the seafood is served in are fantastic, but they are lost on the mushy balls of dough served. Please, bring back the crusty bread!

First timer. Will be back. Nice concept and very comfortable. A bit pricey though for what it is. We used a coupon and if another one comes along we will use it. Very friendly server.Very attentive. Food was okay with the soup being a real winner.

My family and I ate here and it has really gone down hill.  As the other reviews state the rolls are low quality.  Food is not fresh tasting , they should not serve sushi, much better sushi places in town.  Soup was good.  Rest of the food not very good.  The ratings here are right on.

Truly enjoyed a very nice dinner. Made sure to try a little of everything. Oysters from the cold bar, a tempura sushi roll and a wonderful Pan Roast. Asked for the Pan Roast to be a little spicy. And the chef was right on point. 
Service was pleasant and knowledgeable. All staff seemed to be in great spirits which made our visit even more enjoyable.
Excited to return and try a few more entrees.

Glad only the name changed to this place, the previous staff is still here which is great and they always have great service. Oysters always delicious, ice cold and sweet. They were pretty busy during dinner time so some of the oysters weren't fully detached and 1 was pretty chopped up. Still were tasty though.
Being a Seattle native and looking for a great seafood place, Brigg's is epic! Our server Jill was amazing and the experience is exactly like we were at home!
Great atmosphere, great raw oysters, surprisingly good Lobster Roll and great server Luis!
Oyster bar!!!!!  $18/doz. And they have Don Buri!!!  Yum.  Beer is around $5. Entrees start at $17.  Cozy up to the bar, and watch your oysters shucked!!!!

Got there 20 mins til closing and glad i did. Staff was friendly and didn't try rushing us at all. Had the suncoast roll and the rainbow. Both were delicious.  Prices were low for good sushi rolls. Will definitely eat there again.

One of our favorites in LV, food is delicious and fresh, with wonderful specials. The server Regina is absolutely terrific, she always remembers what we like, and has a great temperament. Our favorite chef is Bobby, he comes up with very tasty specials, and he too knows what we like!
Been going since it opened and will continue.

Regina our Lady server was Less than Spectacular!! Oysters Super Fresh!! 
In conclusion.... I will be Back!! Briggs, I'll See You Real Soon!!

I stopped in for a quick bite and had no idea that I was in for such a great experience. The server Regina genuinely described the dishes with an obvious love of the recipes. Chef Booby and his team whipped up my cioppino ( a New Orleans seafood stew) before my eyes in what can only be described as an immaculate exhibition kitchen. When I complemented the food Regina said with a huge smile "I know the whole menu is like that". I will need to keep coming back to prove her right!

Interesting concept. All the cooks and waiters are in the middle of the restaurant and the bar is build in a U shape around them. So, you get to watch them cooking your food. I like the look of the place and they have a lot of good menu items. Being from Maryland originally, I was skeptical to try their 'Maryland' crabcakes. Out west, their idea of a 'Maryland' crabcake is laughable. But this place made 'em just right. The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the waiters who service the bar patrons can barely hear what you're saying since you are separated from them by a large counter. Behind them, the cooks are banging pots and pans. Then you've got Bruce Springsteen playing on the speakers overhead. It was our first time there, and the waitress gave me two items that were the opposite of what I actually ordered. But what I take away from that is to next time eat at the tables where the waitresses actually walk over, lean in and can hear you better. I'm a fan of the restaurant, just not the bar seating.

This place is pretty damn good. The lobster roll is bomb!  The Texas toast that it is served on is perfectly crispy but also chewy and moist! The pan roast is OK. Probably because there are other places in town the specialize in pan roast that are waaaay better. Plus, their pan roast had tiny hard pieces from the crab shell which was sort of a turn off. But, I would come here for the lobster roll again.  The potato wedges that come with it are delicious and a perfect side along with their Cole slaw that has bacon (Yes, bacon!) and corn!  I want to also try the oysters and fish tacos!



NEXT VISIT: Back again - oysters and fish tacos are bomb!  Get the salty oysters. They're smaller but have way more flavor!  

One thing I don't like is how there are always tiny pieces of shell in their lobster dishes. (Pan roast, lobster roll, etc.)

This place was remodeled. The food is always good and the service is awesome. I ordered the lobster sandwich with coleslaw which by the way was amazing and potato wedges. The whole thing was great!! Toast was crispy and lobster tasted fresh. Potato wedges was perfectly cooked and also crispy. I would also recommend the crab cake dinner. The plus side to this is they have a sushi bar for you sushi lovers. Amazing!!!
Tasteless food. Cold rolls out of a bag. Don't need to come back.  Had such hi hopes.
Best service and food. We love the Sole. Quick and speedy service.  Pete and Anthony. Summerlin

Great oysters! Calamari was delicious. The bacon and corn in the coleslaw nicely accented the crab cakes. All of the seafood was very fresh. The surprise of the evening was the mango cheesecake! Our waitress, Jill, was a wonderful combination of spirited and attentive! Definitely coming back for another date night.

$1 oyster night!  Oysters were fresh, tasty and the price was definitely right.  We also had linguini and clams which was cooked to perfection and the portion was large. ($15).  Beers are not overly priced ($5-6).  The space is small and they were very busy with $1 oysters.  My service was good and Kim rocked it!  Come try it out!

It's been my second time here this month and I enjoyed it both times.  It's located inside the casino but close to the entrance so your not walking far to get here.  The food is reasonably priced and all tastes yummy.   I ordered the steamed clam both times and raw oysters.  Yummy! 
Food came out fast and my servers were really on top of it!

I've been frequenting the Suncoast for over 16 years and this is the first time I've tried Briggs, I remember the oyster bar before them, which was great.  

We sat at the counter and were very well received.  Ordered drinks and a couple of starters.  The Caesar Salad was huge and perfect to share.  I love Caesar salads and I must say that this was right on point.  The perfect amount of dressing, romaine and parmesan cheese.   The oysters were from Vancouver (British Columbia) Fanny Bay.  YUM!  had to ask for acrutements (raw horseradish and cocktail sauce) but all in all delicious.  We also had to request bread service??  However Pam jumped on it and took care of it immediately.  The crab cakes were delicious and love the tarragon sauce which was as good as we remembered from the previous establishment.

I ordered the 9 piece Sashimi plate, which consisted of 3 ahi tuna, salmon and yellowfin pieces.  The chef provided me with a delightful soy and citrus sauce for dipping on the side.

When it came to dessert I really wanted a double espresso, unfortunately they don't offer espresso after dinner coffees.  Shocker!   

We still decided to have dessert and Pam recommended the Salted Caramel Crunch Cake....  OMG  it was heavenly.. If you ever try this place you MUST have this dessert.  to die for!

For a Friday night, we feel the service was sufficient, had to request a few things, but in the end left quite satisfied and will most definitely return for more delicious treats.  

Thanks Pam and all the chefs, we truly enjoyed our dinner.
Well unless you are a gambler prepare for a wait.  We arrived with tables available and this restaurant caters to gamblers.  Good people go somewhere else

New oyster spot that opened inside the casino. 

Very fresh food and excellent service! 

Worth the try if your in the area and looking for damn good food.  Reasonable prices for a dozen oysters...

I come here once or twice a month & I love the staff! They're so friendly & attentive. The food is always amazing, oysters taste fresh & ice cold! My favorite meal is the cioppino it's a seafood medley with a tomato broth that's chunky & full of flavor. Bobby is my go-to chef! Wouldn't have it any other way. Definitely worth trying for a local spot!

Late post but...will probably never return.  Not very impressed at all. Pasta from scampi was extremely overcooked and sauce had absolutely no flavor. The crabcakes were ok but the slaw it was served with was awful.  The other seafood dish was just ok too.  Very expensive for what you get.   Had to give it a try though.
Friendly and professional servers with excellent recommendations for wine pairing... excellent food prepared in the busy pro kitchen.... and fabulous specials.. great value!

Briggs delivers good shellfish at a reasonable price.  My gumbo and lobster mac & cheese were both very good, but isn't the definition of a five star rating on Yelp "as good as it gets"?  They weren't quite that good.  I also tasted my wife's crab corn chowder and one of the fried oysters.  Again, good but not great.

I also have to give a little bit of a downgrade for ambiance.  The small room (open to the casino) with stark white tile walls, has a little bit of a fast food restaurant feel to it.

If Briggs was down the street from my office, I would go there for lunch all the time.  (Oddly, Briggs is not open for lunch, although the menu seems perfect for it.)  And I will go back.  But not for a really high end seafood dinner.

Love, love, love. Oysters, calamari, and clam chowder. Delish! Soup a bit rich but very tasty. The red snapper looked gorgeous! I love sitting at the bar and watching the chefs prepare the food. Great camaraderie between the workers and very clean atmosphere. I recommend this oyster bar. My only complaint is that it doesn't open for lunch.

Amazing food! Had the shrimp scampi and lychee martini. My experience there was very welcoming and satisfying. I highly recommend eating here if you enjoy seafood, sushi, drinks and great customer service. Chef Glenn helped me choose from the variety of dishes they served, based on my preference. He is a very talented chef. I plan to go back soon to try more off the menu. Will be asking for chef Glenn again!

This place is great place to eat everything I heard about is true. Great selection of wine, great place to eat great food, and had excellent service by Jill. The fish tacos and the fish and chips are so good here, Can't wait to go back for more.
Oysters were not very good and shrimp Caesar salad was generic.  Shrimp were small and tasted frozen. Service was ok. Overall underwhelmed. Like Big Al's better

Oysters were ok..service was excellent! Ordered shrimp cocktail which had these big shrimps..also ordered lobster Mac and cheese..also yummy! The mussels in white wine were my favorite! My bae ordered the steak.. Which wasn't really a peice of steak..it was like 3 peices of steak but he liked it. The bread they give you kinda suck ..its cold and seem like it came out of a bag..

Hadn't been here in a while, but I'm glad I returned tonight.  Oysters sounded real good - and were they ever!  Fresh, perfectly chilled, and generously sized.  I've been eating oysters for 60 years, and these were gooooooooood!!

This place is so freaking good!!!

This place is located by the front entrance of Suncoast casino. It's easy to find and wasn't crowded when we ate here on a Saturday night. 

Majority of our table got the pan roast but I ordered the shrimp and crab pasta and it sure did not disappoint! The pasta came with big clumps of crab and included big pieces of shrimp. I'm sold on this place because of this pasta dish.

As for the pan roast.... my boyfriend ordered it and completely finished it. He even ate other people's left overs because he could not get enough of it. 

A major plus for me is that if you're looking for a place more convenient than the oyster bar (some locations have a long wait) this is the place to go!

Briggs Oyster Sun Coast Casino - How do you ruin somebody's health with fried oysters for 4 days?  Take rotten spoiled oysters AND undercook them (this past Thursday evening).  

When I warned Suncoast via their message submission webpage - that their restaurant was making people sick - they ignored me.  Zero Star Service. 

By the way, as the waitress had disappeared for so long I left my money on the counter and went to play roulette.  It was only after I got home I realized I was very ill.  Oops.
Sushi was great but their lobster rolls are to die for.   I'm officially hooked.

brigg's   oyster   co   the   one  second   one
bets  the   shell    friend  good    anna   good  fr
Ok restaurant pan roast was so so...hard to appreciate after making oyster bar at palace station our main stay....

Order clam chowder and gumbo the clam chowder with salty and from the bottom of the barrel and very few claims the gumbo was hot which was good very little Seafood clam chowder and gumbo came to $32 I won't be back

We frequent Briggs almost weekly. I think we have gone thru almost the entire menu. I love the crab cakes. They are always crispy and delicious.  The coleslaw that comes with is excellent,  and I'm not a fan of coleslaw.  It is never overdressed, always crunchy and has bacon and corn in it. Yum. My dad usually orders the fish and chips  (which he devours) or the lobster roll.  My mom varies, but enjoys anything she has tried.  Sometimes we order the Caesar salad and an entrée and split both because the portions are huge. Besides the food being tasty,  the staff is what keeps us coming back.  The open kitchen really allows you to interact with the chefs.  Bobby,  one of the chefs,  has a big personality to go with the big flavors he cooks up. He always remembers us and makes the meal feel personalized.  The chefs will also accommodate any taste preferences, such as not to spicy or less sauce, etc. This is great since my mother has certain dietary issues. It really helps her enjoy more menu options knowing they will cater to her restrictions.  Jill, one of our regular servers is another standout.  She is warm and friendly and always has a big smile to greet you with.  She will make you feel like family walking into her home. We love to sit at the bar top to watch the action going on with all the cooking.  That is how we've ended up trying even more dishes each time.....we keep seeing things made and then decide we must try them on our next visit.  Lol. It can get quite busy,  but we've never had to wait more than 15 minutes to be seated.  The sushi selection is not large,  but it is good.  I love to add the seaweed salad as a side for my rolls. It has a great crunch. I can go on and on about this place,  but I think you get the point.  The only time we go to other restaurants is when we need a seafood break since Briggs does not offer a large selection for non-seafood eaters. If you enjoy seafood,  this is your place.

I had wanted to try the previous oyster place but never got the chance.  Before leaving for a show the other night, I went to the Suncoast to try Briggs and I'm glad I did.

I started with some crab cakes--a larger appetizer than I had expected but then one has to make sacrifices.  Following this, I had the seafood gumbo, and I finished the meal with a slice of caramel crunch cake.

The crab cakes were very good with a large amount of crab meat with little filler.  The slaw served with it was a large portion and was quite good.  The whole app is something that would be better shared because there are three cakes along with the slaw.

I then got my seafood gumbo and it was delightful too!  There was a bit of spice to it but not enough to turn anyone off.  The gumbo has lobster, shrimp, andouille, crab, peppers, okra, and a large scoop of rice was put in the bowl before the gumbo was added.  A very filling and tasty meal.

I ended with a slice of salted caramel crunch cake that was good although a little bit on the dry side.

I sat at the bar and service was excellent.  Iced tea was refilled without asking.  It was fun watching the cooks do their thing.  I want to go back as I have some other things I need to try.

The one drawback was that my seat at the bar was in an area where the AC came directly on me.  I was freezing cold all the time I was there even wearing a long sleeve denim short over my t-shirt.

This is a good place for a quick meal or a more relxed one.  I was here just over an hour.
Love this place. Great taste in food. And amazing service from my one and only Jill. Good service and food is hard to find these days. But this place amazing.

Let's start off with me saying that I'm not a fan of seafood. While I'll taste a few things here and there, I would most likely never go out of my way to get a plate of fish or sushi, but I decided to give this place a try. 
We started off with some sushi and jumbo shrimp cocktail. One of the first sushi (I can't remember the name) we tried was actually pretty good (topped with wasabi and ginger), but the California Roll wasn't as good as the previous one. I decided to try oysters for the first time, and I wasn't thrilled or a fan of the flavor whatsoever. We also tried the Corn Crab Chowder and it was actually pretty good and was topped with fresh crab. I love clam chowder and so this one was pretty good. My main course was a crab roll with a side of potato fries and coleslaw. The sandwich was pretty good and the fries were amazing, crispy and flaky just delicious! The coleslaw had bacon in it, and I'm one of the few who aren't a fan of bacon, but I toughed it and I actually couldn't taste the bacon so that was a plus. I must add the waitress was amazing and an awesome person. She made the experience really great.

Hey Folks! 

Save your money and time. This place was horrible. We went during happy hour and the oysters were not in a half shell. Some were broken shells... some were not schuck correctly; a mix and match of "no attention to detail". Some were the lids of the oyster. The California Rolls had fake crab.  The sushi chef was using a dull knife to cut his fish causing the rolls to be lopsided. 

When we finally got our check, the waitress splashed cocktail sauce on wife's white sweater. As humans we all make mistakes, but at least offer 5% off the bill or something. Humor me...

I am embarrassed by this team. They have a lot of kinks to work out.

We will try you again, but it will be a while. Oh yeah, for a seafood place don't serve imitation crab in the soups and the sushi rolls. That tip is free!
#lifehack #training #workharder #careaboutyourjob #comeonman!
The food is amazing!! We had lobster Mac and cheese and I think it's the best I ever had! Oh the fish and chips are super tasty too!

First time here - excellent. We started with a dozen oysters on ice and they were out of this world. Our entrees came out and the fish and chips I ordered seemed small - so they immediately brought out another piece. Food was just terrific. Service and our server Regina could not have been better. We will definitely be back.

Every time we go to Vegas this is a must stop. Glenn on the sushi bar and Martin are terrific and always recommend and prepare the best dishes. Oyster Bay Chardonnay by the glass and a half dozen oysters great starter. Will be there first week in April for the Bishop Gorman Baseball tournament and will hit this place. Looking forward to seeing the remodel.

We found this little pearl ;) about 2 years ago on my Birthday. From the moment we walked in, Pam the beautiful Red Haired Bombshell welcomed us with arms wide open! We were shortly introduced to Glenn and Bobby. We ordered 2 dozen oysters which Glenn promptly shucked in front of us. We followed those with Glenn's special Sushi roll creation and some steamed clams. Ok ok we ordered another 2 dozen oysters. The Red Rose Sushi roll is a must try (named after Pam) and her amazing Rum Collins is refreshing go down easy. Everything Glenn and Chef Bobby make is Amazing!
Needless to say Pam, Glenn and  Bobby have become family. We absolutely LOVE this place. It has become one of our favorite go to places!

I just love the pan roast.  The creamy tomato sauce with rice, lobster, shrimp, and crab is amazing.    Personally not a fan of the sushi.  There is better elsewhere.  The rice is not the best quality for sushi.  But can't go wrong with the pan roast.   You will need extra bread to soak all the creamy sauce.

Chilly nights call for Pan Roast! When I first heard of the Pan Roast I thought it was like a beef roast. It's actually a mix of Lobster, Shrimp, Crab, Tomato, Brandy Cream with some steamed white rice.
I've tried a couple of places around town that serve Pan Roast and they are not all created equal. I'm happy to say that Briggs makes one that is comparable to Palace Station's Pan Roast . They do it in the same style and use steamed rice. There are some Oyster bars which their sauce is brownish and they use like a rice pilaf which is just wrong in my book! This dish is $18.00 and warms you up on a cold day. 

I like the seating at Briggs better then Place Station's because there is more seating even though it is small. They have bar seating and little tables around the bar as well. Palace Station's seating is just the bar area and I feel rushed when I 'm eating because people are literally standing in line beside you as you eat. Briggs is located in the Sun Coast Casino in Summerlin and they also serve sushi.

We sat on the counter at Brigg's Oyster open kitchen, so we could observe the action of the kitchen staff preparing their dish orders. I and my brother shared a half dozen oysters which are of good size, bearing the natural flavor of Louisiana, good fresh ocean taste,yum! 

With a selection of hamachi, rainbow mix, spicy tuna hand roll, California sushi plus an order of salmon sushi.  The fresh fish selection was so wonderful and satisfying. During the dinner 
process, we had a good chat with one of the chefs behind the line and this was a nice exchange  of inter personal contact. With a freshly prepared Seafood chowder, this brought the dinner to a most satisfying conclusion.

Honestly my girlfriend and I have been here the last two nights because of two specific people working here... Ashly and Bobby. They were the most personable and easy going waitress/cook of our entire Vegas experience. The food has been great and our service experience was great because of these two staff members. Thank you so much for a great dinner!!!

Thought I give the new owners a try since the original Oyster Bar got really bad. I first noticed that most of the cooks were the same with a few new faces. They didn't seem to be enjoying their job as they did in the past. 
I ordered the pan roast and a beer. The server took my order promptly (it wasn't very busy), but he didn't bring any bread until he saw me looking around like I needed something. He asked me if I would like some bread with my meal and I said yes. He brought some rolls that were ice cold and looked like they were the kind that you would get at a 99 cent store. The pan roast came, it had maybe 5 small shrimp, about a 2 inch piece of a lobster claw, and some shredded crab meat with a scoop of rice. The sauce was ok, but missing something. Needless to say I was still hungry after eating and really didn't care for the flavor of the sauce. You would think after a few months of bad reviews, the management would have caught on and made some improvements, unfortunately, for me the food is worse than it was before. 
I would rather wait in line for over an hour and a half at Palace Station and get really really great food for the same price. Maybe the owners, managers, and cooks should go there and see how a great pan roast is made!

It's not often I write a bad review about a place before I've even eaten there, however, the absolute lack of respect for customers or simple ability to accommodate guests to open tables warrants the treatment I am writing about.

Questions: 

1. Where is the manager? No one is manning the ship on a night where they are famous for their oyster specials.

2. Why are the staff not cleaning the dirty tables? Tables are sitting idle for 15 minutes at a time while there is a 30-40 minute wait.

3.  Why does the hostess seem to not understand the procedure for seating people at empty tables? Even when the tables have been cleaned and prepared the hostess doesn't look behind her to see where the available tables are at, leaving many agitated customers wondering why they chose to come to this establishment. 

I hope the executive level management take this review and use it as an opportunity to address the concerns I have pointed out. 

A great dining experience does not only depend on the meal. A great dining experience starts with the first encounter.  Please understand that this review is not the result of a whiny customer not getting a table immediately, it is the precipice of horrendous treatment at the hands of ill trained staff.

Finally made it here !! and was pleased with the outcome.
Sat at the counter and quickly knew what I was going to order. Crab Cakes and Shrimp Scampi. The crab cakes were light, fresh tasting, seasoned perfectly and accompanied with a great slaw. The shrimp scampi was portioned perfectly, tasty, light and delicious. Coupled with a Stella draft, I was pleased!!
My server Jill took great care of me, asking how everything was and if I needed anything else, I was too full for desert !!!
Overall, great experience, will be back.
Food is great, but the service is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!! Jill is a Godsend, and treats every customer like their her own family. You will forever have our business because of Jill!! Thank you Jill!!

This spot is located just inside the East Doors of the Sun Coast Casino. You head up the escalators and turn right. It sits between the steak house and the Italian restaurant. The dining area is small, but they have a sushi bar type atmosphere where you can sit at the counter and watch your food be prepared.

We ordered the oysters on the half shell. I think they were about $18 (reasonable price). The oysters were excellent. They were very fresh tasting, but they were gulf coast oysters and I was not aware that they also had cold water oysters available. I would have rather had the cold water oysters, but I did not find out until after dinner when I was talking to the cook. The server should let you know that you have a choice of oysters from different regions when you are ordering. We also ordered the steamed mussels, which came with the standard butter and lemon sauce. The mussels were also very fresh tasting.

I ordered the fish & chips for my entree. They use tempura as their batter for the cod. You get two pieces with fries and cole slaw. The fish was pretty good. Was not greasy at all. The cole slaw comes with roasted corn and bacon mixed in it. I don't eat pork, so one of the cooks mixed me some fresh slaw with just the roasted corn and no bacon. That was nice of him.

The service was very good overall. I would say excellent, but they forgot our bread basket. It was also very slow when I was there, so I can't say how good or bad the service is when it is busy.

I will definitely be back and I would recommend that you give it a try. The total bill was $72.00 for a dozen oysters, a dozen steamed mussels, 2 orders of fish & chips, one Blue Moon. and one soda.

Honestly there is no better place than the oyster bar at the palace station, all others are just imitators. The decore is very refreshing and appealing. The good part is that there wasn't a wait to get our table and the service was quick and smooth. 
The food was good but whoever said this place was great has never been to the real thing. We ordered the pan roast and the crab cakes. Both dishes were fine but they both lacked some flavor. I guess it's not a terrible option of you are close by, but not the best one in town.

First off me and my boo have different days off so we were lucky to have a few hours together so we go to Suncoast close quiet. We choose Briggs ole oyster bar ! What a disappointment that was! Waitress was so clueless about customer service when their 39$ fillet tasted like I could make it! Should have stayed home!!  I liked the clams still waiting for the manager what a waste!!

Omg such an amazing improvement over the place that was here before! We had the dozen raw oysters Caesar shrimp salad and corn chowder DEVINE best part besides stellar food exceptional service by Jose and the back staff will be back

I ordered 5 dozen oysters tonight. Yup. They had the big ones from Louisiana and 2 of the small varieties from Canada, the Pacific Northwest basically. The smaller one were sweet and had a little firmer texture. But the medium size one was my favorite. The big fat ones were juicy but there's a small bitter after taste I think (maybe that's the BP Gold that's still giving after all these years from those waters). All were fresh. I am afraid if they were any fresher, they'd be squirting water at me.

Excellent service. We went at about 6:30pm so had to wait 15 minutes but it went by fast. I didn't bother to get the clam chowder today. But if you are in the mood it's $6 for a bowl.

The rolls were tasty. Two types. One had oats and some other thing in it and the other was more of a dinner roll but they both tasted like they were recently baked.
Nobody watching the front and we never got seated. People at the oyster bar ignored us. Bad business.

Came by to check this place after several visits to the SunCoast, this time I decided that today is the day found myself having to swap the night away killing nat's, mentioned to waitress said she would mention to management..which must to have just disregarded the issue, guess we don't need to come back :/

This place looks cool but the service is pretty slow and it's not even that busy.   I got a dozen oysters and asked them to give me the smallest ones they had.  They came out with these huge oysters instead totally disregarding my order.  I sent them back and they brought out much smaller ones the second time.  But they didn't bring any sauce so I had to wait for the set up of sauces.  

I also ordered the linguini and clams and that was soooo over cooked I couldn't even eat it, it was absolutely terrible and that is something I love to eat so I was very disappointed. The pasta was very mushy and the sauce was so thick it was awful I could only eat the 5 clams on top.  So after an hour I am still hungry I wouldn't recommend this spot at all. 

However my server was very sweet and didn't charge me for the linguini and clams that she could tell I didn't like even tho I didn't say anything about not liking it.

We absolutely love everything about this casual place.  We always have the best service from the staff.  The Dragon rolls that Glen makes are the best we have had anywhere, we walk in and don't even have to order it, he is getting ready for us.  The oysters are superb, fresh and reasonably priced.  The wine selection is great and the menu is diverse but not so large that you are overwhelmed with choices.  It's fun to sit at the counter and watch the food being prepared.  We travel from the other side of town just to comes to Briggs.  5 stars!!!

We haven't been here since they changed it up awhile back--so we thought we'd give it a try. 

Cleaniness and overall look: 5 stars
Service and friendliness: 5 stars
Food: 3 stars

That would give it 4 stars, right? I can't do it. Seriously, the staff was super awesome. But the food was okay. And let's face it--if the food isn't that good, it's hard to give it more stars. 

We had:

Ceaser salad - no different than your average salad and there was nothing that stood out. 
Clam Chowder - I wasn't the biggest fan.  My fiance was and said it was great. I did not agree. It wasn't as creamy as I was hoping. More water based to me. 
Crab cakes - this was my favorite. I love crab cakes that are mostly crab and not filling. It also came with some bomb-ass coleslaw. 
Pan Roast - it left me wanting a richer flavor. It was more watery and very tomato based. Which most of them are, but I was thinking it'd be more creamy. To me, it was bland. It had plenty of seafood in it too. 

This place is good. It really seems like a solid 3 stars. It's just hard to compare when you have some amazing oyster bars in town. 
For me: if you call it an "Oyster Bar"--you should have way more than one type of Oyster to offer. If you don't, I think you should just be called a "seafood bar."

In vegas for a work trip, and decided to try this place out since it was in the hotel. It was so amazing! 

My server was so friendly, welcoming and attentive, the food came in a timely manner and was sooo delicious (I had a half dozen oysters, a sushi roll and lobster mac and cheese)! Their Riesling is also delicious. The atmosphere is fun and open and the open concept cooking/kitchen was also a fun aspect to this place. 

Love love love this place!

Visited Briggs tonight and did not have a great experience.  Decided to visit due to the marketing for $1.00 oysters all day on its website.  Upon arrival I was informed that the $1.00 special only is on certain days.  I specifically pulled up the website on my phone and showed the hostess and the manager that did it does not say that the special is only on certain nights.  It does state that there are special oysters on specific nights but nothing else.  Finally I took a seat at the bar and we ordered clams, crab corn chowder, and a dozen oysters.  The manager, Laura Bushman, came back over to us and said she reviewed the website and said it stated $1.00 oysters were only on special days.  She then was extremely condescending and truly was not very apologetic.  She treated me and my fiancé as if we were in the wrong and made us feel very unwelcome.  Our server Alex informed us that we are not the only customers that think this on a daily basis.  He actually was apologetic, showed empathy and tried to make our experience better.  The crab corn chowder came out and it was simply corn chowder with crab pieces on top.  It was not what we expected and it was not even hot, so it was sent back.  The clams came out for my fiancé and she enjoyed them, but my oysters did not come out until she was half way done with her meal.
This has the potential of being a good place.  If management would consider taking care of their customers better then I am sure they would be rated better.  Our business can be spent better elsewhere especially at places we feel appreciated and welcome.

Moving on up! Happy to announce that Oyster Bar has returned to its glory days.  Came here again to see the lovely staff (Glenn, Luis, Bobby, and Jamie) and was happy to see that Briggs has worked out all the kinks with the change in ownership. So let me give you the run down for menu items: 
First things first! The bread is no longer cold dinner rolls from a bag. Wahooooo! They now serve warm Hawaiian Bread and cheese bread. If You are ordering sushi, and Glenn is making it, it will be the best sushi of your life. Crab cakes are still a no go.  The lobster roll is delicious but rich. They comes with the best steak fries everrrrr. The lobster mac and cheese is also delicious but also very rich. Its very filling and probably should be shared.  Fish tacos are still my favorite. (Martin makes the best fish tacos).  I usually order it off the appetizer menu as I do not eat cole slaw and it's a bit cheaper (it comes with 3). My husband still loves the panroast. (I'm not a fan).  The clam chowder is a no go. It used to be really good but now it is freakishly thick. I think the warmers are causing the potatoes to overcook and becoming mushy (causing the thickness).

Anyways, we love this place. We eat here at least once a day while we stay at the Suncoast.

The two of us visited Brigg's twice since my first not-so-stellar review, written when they had just opened, and last night was another hit !  I can't comment on sushi or oysters because they're not on our radar, but we had the Pan Roast and the Gumbo.  Both dishes came out in a short time and the spicy seasoning in both was perfect.  The Gumbo with sausage and seafood on rice was rich & delicious, and the portion just right.  I loved my Pan Roast w/crab, shrimp & lobster (also on rice) & enjoyed the leftovers for lunch today.

It feels so much like community sitting at the counter and we espec. like that Briggs is open to the casino ( without being obtrusive), and the vibes from employees added to the ambiance.   We spoke to the manager, Laura, about our happy experience & I recommended Fr. baquettes or a good sourdough in the bread basket.  She said this coming week they were experimenting with different breads, & has always been receptive to suggestions.

Another time we liked the fish fry w/steak fries & a really good coleslaw.  I am a big fan of their seafood salad, now that they informed me to ask for it NOT to be tossed.  It's substantial & so healthy.  The last time there my partner had the $20  steak on regular menu & it was a winner.  Melted in your mouth!  And special potatoes were good also.

So, now that most of the kinks have been worked out and 3-4 items are on daily special, & employees seem to be in place, go on over to Brigg's at Suncoast.  I doubt you'll be disappointed.

How do I phrase a two star review eloquently? 
I've been to this establishment quite a few times, the oysters come out fast, and usually the service is good. 
I don't know if one of the waitresses has ever been out to eat with company, but usually it's best to send out orders together so you can eat around the same time. Not fifteen minutes apart. 
I'd rather not get blatantly lied to my face on why it's taking so long, I've worked around food before. Also no apology about the wait being so long? What is that? 
And forget ordering sushi, the rice has a sour taste to it. The fish is okay, but alas it come with the awful sour rice.

This place is of my favorite place to eat sushi. Thanks the chef who is very friendly , great customer interacion, knows what I wanted every time I visit,  I mean he can't go wrong always on point. I believe the chefs name is Glen..great guy...

So we are staying at the Suncoast resort, my son is in a hockey tournament, we get here around 7pm, I am hungry so we all decided to have some oysters and sushi.
Place is in our hotel. Clean and our server was awesome.
My water was always full. The best part was the food was great. I have high standards being I live in Petaluma Ca,
This place delivered. 
The best part the staff at this hotel from the front desk to the security guard were all friendly and seemed like every one was happy.

Whoa!! For a $175 dollar bill I was very disappointed with the food. My husband ordered the scampi and it was average and was served with no bread. The oysters were good but they failed to shell them properly so we had some extra work ahead of us. When I told the server he just chuckled and walked away. The sushi we ordered was the rainbow roll, spicy tuna roll and an eel roll. I'm very positive that they pre-roll all the sushi because the rice was dry and the "fresh" tuna and salmon were pale. We sent it back due to fear it would make us severely sick. My mouth about dropped to the floor when the Manager Laura spoke to the table next to us. They ordered the steamed clams and had the server bring new broth because it was bland. When they received their bill they asked for a manager and Laura came over to speak with them. I couldn't believe it when she looked at the guest that ordered it and said "well... You ate it didn't you?! Are you still hungry?!?" My mouth dropped to the floor. I couldn't believe it when she told them she was taking the steamed clams off she pretty much blamed it on the guest and said to next time tell us. That manager is so oblivious, they did and she should've walked to the table that moment it happened. She is out of her mind if she thinks they are coming back. This was our first and last time here. Don't serve things like sushi if you don't have the space to make it fresh and get a manager that can diffuse a situation. 
Coaching moment Laura: tell your guest you'll give them a voucher to come back once you fix the issues your staff made. Own it!
The fried oysters are pretty heavy and the breading is thicker and more oily than I prefer. I suppose it is a matter of taste but I can't say I would be anxious to go back again

Without any doubt this place serves best sushi in all Las vegas. My husband and I come here at least twice a week to try the sushi made by Glenn. He is an excellent chef and is always attentive with us and everyone else as well. I recommend this place to everyone.

Last night was my wife's birthday celebration, a big one at that. She only wanted Oysters so we went to Briggs. The last time we were there was probably 4 years ago and they told us they were out of oysters. Impossible I said and sent them upstairs to the steak house to steal their oysters and that's exactly what happened. 
Last night they had plenty of oysters and they were succulent and sweet. The horseradish was extremely hot, great server and my wife was extremely happy.
We started with a crab cake and fried oyster appetizers which were made fresh in clean oil and served nicely. Both very tasty, but I felt the sauces they served with them were lacking personality. 
I also had the seafood chowder which is the red and white clam chowders mixed and supersized with shrimp, lobster, potatoes and so much more. I would definitely eat it again. 
Our daughter had a sushi roll and said it was very fresh 
All in all this was a great experience. The food was very good and we will do it again. 
We did notice the Suncoast opened. A new Chinese restaurant. That's next on our list. Maybe we will order takeout 
We recommend this place. Casual, fairly quick and not expensive 
Our server is one of the women who has been at this restaurant a long time. She knew exactly what she was doing, was very pleasant to talk too and she was very attentive to the birthday girl.
